snippet: American employers added 175,000 jobs in May, which matched the average monthly jobs increase over the last year, while the unemployment rate ticked up to 7.6 percent.
abstract: Hiring in United States is rising, but not quickly enough to have much effect on backlog of nearly 12 million unemployed workers left stranded by recession and its aftermath; American employers added 175,000 jobs in May, matching average monthly jobs increase over last year, while unemployment ticked up to 7.6 percent.
lead_paragraph: American employers added 175,000 jobs in May, which matched the average monthly jobs increase over the last year, while the unemployment rate ticked up to 7.6 percent.

headline.seo: Middling Jobs Gain Signals a Long Path to Healthy Payrolls
headline.main:
Middling Jobs Numbers
Signal a Long Path
to Healthy Payrolls
headline.print_headline: Hiring Rises, but Pace Remains Sluggish
